meanings.definition: To use capital letters in writing.
meanings.sent1: She always capitalises the first letter of her name.
meanings.sent2: In formal writing, it is important to capitalise proper nouns.
meanings.sent3: The teacher reminded the students to capitalise the beginning of each sentence.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting capitalises beautifully on the page, making it easy to read.
meanings.sent5: The sign outside capitalises boldly to grab attention.

meanings.definition: To take advantage of or profit from something.
meanings.sent1: He capitalises on his opponent's weaknesses during the game.
meanings.sent2: Successful businesses often capitalise on market trends.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox capitalises on the distraction to steal the food.
meanings.sent4: She always capitalises on the opportunity to learn something new.
meanings.sent5: The company capitalises on its unique selling point to attract customers.

meanings.definition: To provide funding for a business or project.
meanings.sent1: Investors are willing to capitalise the startup for its innovative idea.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to capitalise the new infrastructure project.
meanings.sent3: The generous donor offered to capitalise the charity event.
meanings.sent4: The bank agreed to capitalise the expansion of the small business.
meanings.sent5: The venture capitalist decided to capitalise the promising tech startup.
